scenarioDescription:
The MOA-2013-BLG-220L Exoplanetary System


Overview

MOA-2013-BLG-220L is a star with 0.88 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 21917.68 light years away from the solar system.

MOA-2013-BLG-220L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the MOA-2013-BLG-220L system


MOA-2013-BLG-220L b

MOA-2013-BLG-220L b was discovered by the MOA observatory, in 2014-07, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 3.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of MOA-2013-BLG-220L b is 871.320 times the mass of Earth. The radius of MOA-2013-BLG-220L b is 13.200 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, MOA-2013-BLG-220L b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system MOA-2013-BLG-220L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the MOA.
name: MOA-2013-BLG-220L - System With 1 Exoplanet
